intro: Erodium × lindavicum, commonly known as the hybrid common strewer, is a flowering plant in the family Portulacaceae. It is a naturally occurring hybrid between Erodium caryophyllaceum and Erodium vulgare, exhibiting a combination of traits from both parent species. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and is found in various habitats such as roadsides and open fields. It produces small, pink or purple flowers and has a low, spreading growth habit. Its botanical characteristics make it an interesting subject for studies on hybridization and plant adaptation.
